TALLAHASSEE - An attempt to get rid of the cameras that catch red - light runners at some Florida intersections died in the Legislature this year , as do most of the bills filed for the annual spring session .

RelatedSentence: And this particular measure died , in typical fashion for Tallahassee , after the company that provides most of the cameras in the state got involved .

State Sen. Jeff Brandes , a St. Petersburg Republican , held a joint news conference in early February with state Rep. Frank Artiles , a Miami Republican , declaring war on the cameras .

RelatedSentence: We are always interested in working constructively with legislators and any other stakeholders to help find consensus on good public policy , said Territo , the company 's senior vice president .
The Legislature approved the use of cameras statewide in 2010 to crack down on red light runners and decrease collisions .
Violators must pay a $ 158 fine but do n't get any points on their licenses .
